private_information: I am one of two manipulators that can pick up, put down, unstack and stack blocks on the table
I can only move a block if it is clear and only one block can be carried at a time
manipulator1.goal: Work together to execute and report the observed block actions and help produce a consolidated plan and final state.

private_information: I am the other manipulator that can pick up, put down, unstack and stack blocks
I can only move top blocks and carry one block at a time
manipulator2.goal: Work together to execute and report the observed block actions and help produce a consolidated plan and final state.

private_information: I integrate observations and produce a single consolidated PDDL domain and problem for a FastDownwards run
I must keep actions of different manipulators distinct when orchestrating a multi-agent view
orchestrator.goal: Generate a final PDDL domain and problem, suitable for FastDownwards, that captures the blocks world instance and the executed action sequence, and produce the final block arrangement.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World domain. Only the top block of a stack can be moved. Only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved are A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K.

Initial arrangement: A is on top of D. B is on top of G. C is on top of J. D is on the table. E is on the table. F is on top of K. G is on top of A. H is on the table. I is on top of C. J is on top of E. K is on top of B.
Interpreted initial stacks bottom to top are: Stack1: D, A, G, B, K, F. Stack2: E, J, C, I. Stack3: H.

The agents execute the following actions in order: 1 pickup(H) 2 stack(H, F) 3 unstack(H, F) 4 stack(H, I) 5 unstack(H, I) 6 stack(H, I) 7 unstack(H, I) 8 stack(H, I) 9 unstack(H, I) 10 putdown(H) 11 unstack(I, C) 12 putdown(I) 13 unstack(C, J) 14 stack(C, F) 15 unstack(J, E) 16 stack(J, H) 17 pickup(I) 18 stack(I, C) 19 pickup(E) 20 stack(E, J) 21 unstack(E, J) 22 stack(E, I) 23 unstack(E, I) 24 putdown(E) 25 unstack(I, C) 26 stack(I, E) 27 unstack(J, H) 28 stack(J, H) 29 unstack(J, H) 30 stack(J, C).

Task: Using the initial configuration and the exact action sequence above, derive the final arrangement of the blocks and produce a PDDL domain and problem that capture the instance for FastDownwards.

report.system_prompt: You are manipulator1. Provide a concise structured observation of the initial local view of the stacks and the subset of actions you executed or directly observed. Do not emit PDDL. Describe only facts you are certain about.
report.prompt: Your name is manipulator1. You observe the Blocks World with public information provided in environment->public_information. You have private knowledge: environment->agents->manipulator1->private_information. Your goal is environment->agents->manipulator1->goal. Produce a clear structured observation of initial stacks and the actions you executed or witnessed, expressed as a list of facts and a list of observed actions in order. Do not produce PDDL. If you are missing information, report only what you know for sure.

report.system_prompt: You are manipulator2. Provide a concise structured observation of the initial local view of the stacks and the subset of actions you executed or directly observed. Do not emit PDDL. Describe only facts you are certain about.
report.prompt: Your name is manipulator2. You observe the Blocks World with public information provided in environment->public_information. You have private knowledge: environment->agents->manipulator2->private_information. Your goal is environment->agents->manipulator2->goal. Produce a clear structured observation of initial stacks and the actions you executed or witnessed, expressed as a list of facts and a list of observed actions in order. Do not produce PDDL. If you are missing information, report only what you know for sure.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the manipulators' observations into a single coherent Blocks World representation. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of different manipulators distinct if observations indicate different actors. The output must be usable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive observations from manipulator1 and manipulator2 as inputs. Your goal is environment->agents->orchestrator->goal. Integrate the inputs observation_manipulator1 and observation_manipulator2, resolve any naming inconsistencies, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the initial state and the executed actions as needed for validation or repro. The PDDL must be explicit and compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also output a concise final arrangement summary consistent with the PDDL.
